intro: Thiloa gracilis var. major, commonly known as the slender thiloa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along streambanks. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
